channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: IPhone 17 vs. Samsung Galaxy S25: Which Compact Flagship Is Right for You?
item.dc:creator: Shikhar Mehrotra
item.description: Statistically speaking, most of us will end up with one of these.
item.content:encoded: Cupertino-based tech giant Apple has unveiled its new baseline iPhone, the iPhone 17. With a 6.3-inch ProMotion screen, the powerful A19 chip, and a bigger battery, the phone makes a strong case for itself. But how does it compare to Samsung's Galaxy S25? Let's find out.

item.title: Top Tech Deals: Save Big on Wi-Fi 7 Routers, Dash Cams, iMacs & More!
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Don't miss out on these incredible deals while they're still available.
item.content:encoded: This week's tech deals include all sorts of exciting gadgets you'll surely love. Whether you're looking to buy a new dash cam, upgrade your TV to an 85-inch beast for football season, or get a new iMac, we have you covered.

item.title: I’ve Been Using Calibre All Wrong
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: I hated Calibre until I made this one change.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been using Calibre wrong for the past several months. While I had Calibre running on my server, and it worked to send books to my Kindle via Send to Kindle, I actually had it installed completely wrong and should have been using it differently the entire time.

item.title: How to Insert and Use a PivotChart in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Impress your coworkers with this powerful data visualization tool.
item.content:encoded: It's no secret that charts are one of the best ways in Microsoft Excel to visualize your data for quick analysis. However, if you're dealing with a particularly large or complex dataset or want a chart to be interactive and dynamic, PivotCharts are the way to go.

item.title: Spotify Finally Joins the Hi-Res Streaming Party
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: After years of anticipation, Spotify Premium users can finally experience lossless audio streaming.
item.content:encoded: After years of rumors and waiting, it's finally here. Spotify has a lossless audio option for those who want a better streaming experience. We've been hearing about it since 2021, and today Spotify Premium users can finally take advantage of lossless streaming.

item.title: 9 Ways to Edit Text With the sed Command on Linux
item.dc:creator: Haroon Javed
item.description: Transform how you work with text files on Linux.
item.content:encoded: One of the go-to tools for text editing in Linux is sed, the stream editor. It's a text editor without an interface that performs operations quietly, straight from the command line. From quick fixes to advanced text transformations, here are nine ways the sed command makes editing easier.

item.title: Best Movie Years Ever: 1974—The Auteur Era
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Our rundown of the groundbreaking films of 1974 that launched the careers of Hollywood's most revered filmmakers. A must-read for cinephiles!
item.content:encoded: 1974 was a movie year that established filmmaking legends. It saw remarkable direction from the likes of Mel Brooks, Francis Ford Coppola, and John Cassavetes. Fantastic actors such as Al Pacino, Gene Hackman, and Jack Nicholson also provided iconic performances.

item.title: 9 John Candy Movies That Will Rekindle Your Love for the Comedy Icon
item.dc:creator: Derek Malcolm
item.description: I grew up on John Candy movies, and these are nine of his best.
item.content:encoded: John Candy was much more than just a comedic actor—he was, and is, a Canadian national treasure, revered alongside other late great icons like Phil Hartman, Norm MacDonald, and Leslie Nielsen. But Candy's warmth, humor, and larger-than-life presence had a huge impact globally, too, and it's still being felt.

item.title: 10 Movies With Hilariously Retro Technology
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the films with tech so dated they’re kinda cute in all their speculative glory.
item.content:encoded: Watching old movies can give us a snapshot not just of the era, but also of what old films considered innovative and modern. While dated clothing is always a lark, old tech has a certain charm. If you’re a geek and, I mean, look at the website you’re on, you’re probably fascinated anytime a CRT monitor or DOS-style prompt populates an older movie, whether you lived through that era or not.

item.title: Should You Wait for the iPhone 18, 18 Pro, or Foldable iPhone?
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: There will always be a better iPhone just around the corner.
item.content:encoded: The iPhone 17 is here, with a brand new slim model and the usual feature-rich Pro models in tow. Now is the perfect time to think about what next year holds, especially if you’re weighing up whether or not this year’s upgrade is worth it.
